description: Mobile techniques used by Ginp, ATT&CK software S0423 v1.1
name: Ginp (S0423)

techniques.comment: [Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can download the device’s contact list.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can download device log data.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can obtain a list of installed applications.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can collect SMS messages.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can download device logs.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can determine if it is running in an emulator.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can inject input to make itself the default SMS handler.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can use a multi-step phishing overlay to capture banking credentials and then credit card numbers after login.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) has masqueraded as “Adobe Flash Player” and “Google Play Verificator”.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) obfuscates its payload, code, and strings.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can capture device screenshots and stream them back to the C2.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) can send SMS messages.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
[Ginp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0423) hides its icon after installation.(Citation: ThreatFabric Ginp)
